capabilities.name: Agent Mode
capabilities.description: Chat-like terminal interface that can autonomously create/modify files, execute commands, and iterate on results

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - agent mode workflow for autonomous file creation, editing, and command execution
sources.excerpt: The command-line interface (CLI) for GitHub Copilot allows you to use Copilot directly from your terminal for autonomous task execution.

sources.description: Copilot CLI overview - agent mode as core capability
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI overview - the command-line interface for GitHub Copilot provides agent mode as a core autonomous capability.

capabilities.name: Sub-agents
capabilities.description: Copilot CLI can delegate tasks to built-in subagent processes for specialized work. Built-in agents include: Explore (file/codebase search), Task (coordinate multi-step work), General-purpose, and Code-review. The AI model autonomously selects the appropriate subagent for each subtask.

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - subagent delegation with built-in Explore, Task, General-purpose, and Code-review agents
sources.excerpt: The AI model can delegate a task to a subsidiary subagent process. Built-in agents include Explore, Task, General-purpose, and Code-review.

capabilities.name: Code Generation
capabilities.description: Generate code and implement features from natural language descriptions directly in the terminal

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - generating code from natural language descriptions in the terminal
sources.excerpt: Request for Copilot to perform a specific task, such as fixing a bug, adding a feature to an existing application in the terminal.

capabilities.name: Multi-file Editing
capabilities.description: Create, edit, or delete files across a project based on natural language instructions

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - creating, editing, and deleting files across a project
sources.excerpt: To complete a task, Copilot may need to work with files that are outside the current working directory for multi-file operations.

capabilities.name: Terminal CLI
capabilities.description: Full terminal-based AI assistant that executes commands, runs tests, and manages development workflows

sources.description: Copilot CLI overview - terminal-based AI assistant for development workflows
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI overview - terminal-based AI assistant for development workflows including file editing and command execution.

sources.description: CLI command reference - full command and flag documentation
sources.excerpt: copilot help [topic] Display help information. Help topics include: config, commands, environment, logging, and permissions.

capabilities.name: Debugging
capabilities.description: Debug issues by running commands, analyzing output, and proposing fixes iteratively

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - debugging issues by running commands, analyzing output, and proposing fixes
sources.excerpt: The command-line interface for GitHub Copilot allows debugging issues by running commands, analyzing output, and proposing fixes iteratively.

capabilities.name: Test Generation
capabilities.description: Generate and run tests, with automated test failure analysis

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - generating and running tests with automated failure analysis
sources.excerpt: Executes commands such as tests and builds, providing brief summaries on success and full output on failure for iterative fixing.

capabilities.name: Documentation Generation
capabilities.description: Create and update documentation from the command line

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - creating and updating documentation from the command line
sources.excerpt: The command-line interface for GitHub Copilot allows creating and updating documentation from the command line.

capabilities.name: Chat Assistance
capabilities.description: Interactive chat in the terminal for coding questions and guidance

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - interactive terminal chat for coding questions and guidance
sources.excerpt: You can interact with Copilot while it's thinking. Send follow-up messages to steer the conversation in different directions.

capabilities.name: Multi-language Support
capabilities.description: Support for multiple programming languages (English as primary interaction language)

sources.description: Copilot CLI overview - multi-language programming support
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI overview page covering multi-language programming support in the command-line interface environment.

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - language support in interactive sessions
sources.excerpt: The command-line interface for GitHub Copilot allows working with multiple programming languages in interactive terminal sessions.

capabilities.name: MCP Support
capabilities.description: Model Context Protocol server support. The GitHub MCP server is pre-configured out of the box. Additional MCP servers can be added via /mcp add or the copilot mcp command group.

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - GitHub MCP server pre-configured, /mcp add for additional servers
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI comes with the GitHub MCP server already configured. Additional MCP servers can be added via /mcp add or copilot mcp add commands.

capabilities.name: Custom Instructions
capabilities.description: Repository-level coding instructions via .github/copilot-instructions.md (shared across team) and AGENTS.md (agent-aware instructions). User-level and organization-level instruction files also supported. Instructions are automatically loaded and applied to all agent sessions.

sources.description: GitHub Copilot custom repository instructions - .github/copilot-instructions.md documentation
Using Copilot CLI - AGENTS.md and instruction file support in agent sessions
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI automatically loads .github/copilot-instructions.md and AGENTS.md instruction files to customize agent behavior for your repository.

capabilities.name: Model Selection
capabilities.description: Choose from multiple AI models via --model flag or /model slash command during sessions. Supports OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google models available in your Copilot plan.

sources.description: CLI command reference - --model flag and /model slash command for model switching
sources.excerpt: --model MODEL Use a specific AI model for this session. /model Switch the AI model for the current session.

capabilities.name: Extended Thinking
capabilities.description: Access to reasoning-capable models (e.g., o3, Claude with extended thinking) via model selection. Reasoning models perform deeper analysis before responding, useful for complex architecture decisions and multi-step problems.

sources.description: CLI command reference - model selection enables access to reasoning-capable models
sources.excerpt: Use --model to select reasoning-capable models including o3 and Claude with extended thinking for complex problem solving.

capabilities.name: Prompt and Context Inspector
capabilities.description: /context visualizes detailed current token usage breakdown. Ctrl+T toggles display of model reasoning process (persists across sessions). Ctrl+O/Ctrl+E expand recent/all timeline items to review agent action sequences. Shift+Tab toggles plan mode to preview implementation approach before execution.

sources.description: CLI command reference - /context slash command, Ctrl+T reasoning toggle, Ctrl+O/Ctrl+E timeline expansion, Shift+Tab plan mode
sources.excerpt: /context Show the context window token usage and visualization. Ctrl+T toggles display of model reasoning process.

capabilities.name: Debug Logging
capabilities.description: --log-level flag with granular levels (none, error, warning, info, debug, all). Logs written to --log-dir (default: ~/.copilot/logs/). Session export via --share (Markdown file) or --share-gist (secret GitHub Gist).

sources.description: CLI command reference - --log-level, --log-dir flags, --share and --share-gist session export
sources.excerpt: Set the log level (choices: none, error, warning, info, debug, all, default). Logs written to --log-dir directory.

capabilities.name: Usage Tracking
capabilities.description: /usage displays session statistics: premium request count, duration, lines edited, and token breakdown. Auto-compaction triggers at 95% token limit to preserve context. /compact for manual context compression. Agent Client Protocol (--acp) enables programmatic session monitoring via NDJSON over stdio or TCP.

sources.description: CLI command reference - /usage slash command, /compact context compression, --acp Agent Client Protocol flag
sources.excerpt: /usage Display session usage metrics and statistics. Auto-compaction triggers at 95% token limit to preserve context.

capabilities.name: Lifecycle Hooks
capabilities.description: Six hook events (sessionStart, sessionEnd, userPromptSubmitted, preToolUse, postToolUse, errorOccurred) configured in .github/hooks/hooks.json. Hooks receive JSON on stdin with timestamp, cwd, toolName, toolArgs, and prompt. Scripts can log to files, send webhooks, or return permission decisions for preToolUse.

sources.description: CLI command reference - six hook events and .github/hooks/hooks.json configuration
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI command reference documenting hook events and .github/hooks/hooks.json configuration for lifecycle management.

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - configuring and using lifecycle hooks
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI supports lifecycle hooks configured in .github/hooks/hooks.json for session, prompt, and tool events.

capabilities.name: Extension System
capabilities.description: Plugins extend Copilot CLI functionality. Installed from marketplaces (copilot plugin install NAME@MARKETPLACE), GitHub repos (copilot plugin install OWNER/REPO:PATH), or local paths. Managed via copilot plugin list/update/uninstall. Stored in ~/.copilot/installed-plugins/.

sources.description: Copilot CLI Plugins - finding and installing plugins from marketplaces, GitHub, or local paths

capabilities.name: Code Explanation
capabilities.description: Explain code, shell commands, and error messages. Dedicated 'gh copilot explain' command for shell command explanation. Agent mode can explain any code in the project through natural language conversation.

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - gh copilot explain command for code and command explanation
sources.excerpt: Use 'gh copilot explain' to get explanations of shell commands, code snippets, and error messages directly in your terminal.

capabilities.name: Code Refactoring
capabilities.description: Refactor code through agent mode â€” rename variables, extract functions, restructure files, and apply design patterns across the codebase via natural language instructions.

sources.description: Using Copilot CLI - agent mode for code refactoring and multi-file editing
sources.excerpt: Copilot CLI agent mode autonomously reads, edits, and restructures code across multiple files to implement refactoring tasks.
